main event: A bright object, believed to be in orbit, was observed moving at high constant speed from NW to SE in Juneau, Alaska on May 10, 1961.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 10 minutes., The object appeared to be the size of a star., The observer used 8 power Zeiss binoculars for a closer look., Object disappeared over Mt. Roberts at an elevation of 45 degrees., The weather conditions were clear and calm at the time of the observation.
witness description: a 45-year-old marine surveyor observing from Glacier Highway
